meanings.definition: The quality of being suitable for paid work.
meanings.sent1: Her employability impressed the employer during the interview.
meanings.sent2: His employability increased after completing the training program.
meanings.sent3: The robot's employability was questioned when it kept making mistakes.
meanings.sent4: His employability was like a shining beacon in the sea of job applicants.
meanings.sent5: The employability of the candidate stood out among the rest.

meanings.definition: The ability to be hired for a job.
meanings.sent1: His employability was evident from his strong resume.
meanings.sent2: She lacked the employability needed to secure the position.
meanings.sent3: The cat's employability as a mouse catcher was put to the test.
meanings.sent4: The employability of the new graduate was like a golden ticket.
meanings.sent5: The employability of the candidate was undeniable.

meanings.definition: The skills and qualities that make someone attractive to employers.
meanings.sent1: Improving your employability can lead to better job opportunities.
meanings.sent2: Her employability was evident through her strong work ethic.
meanings.sent3: The clown's employability in a serious office setting was comical.
meanings.sent4: His employability shone like a diamond in the rough.
meanings.sent5: The employability of the candidate was unmatched.
